programmes.show_description: Connor Phillips is live through the night from the Salford Riviera with Midnight Mastermind, Wish You Were There, Midnight Caller and a huge Ravio 2 to end the week.

programmes.show_name: Alternative Sounds of the 90s with Dermot O'Leary
programmes.show_description: Dermot picks some of his favourite Brits winners of the 90s, including Pulp, Bjork and Belle & Sebastian.
It's Early Breakfast with Owain Wyn Evans, featuring Airdrum Anthems and Step Back in Time!  Who are you? Where are you? and What are you looking forward to this weekend?
Scott announces where Radio 2 In The Park 2026 will be... and WHEN!
Vernon looks back on an amazing Piano Room Month 2026 ahead of our final best of, and it's the final edition of Ten To The Top of this week.
Vernon has highlights from Week 4 of Radio 2's Piano Room Month 2026 - featuring Blue, Laufey, Tori Amos and Jessie J accompanied by the BBC Concert Orchestra.
Tina Daheley and guests discuss the news headlines and talk to the people making them.
Trevor is bringing you some of the best music from across the decades to get you through the afternoon.
It's All Request Friday, and Sara wants to hear from you on 88291 or sara.cox@bbc.co.uk.
You've found the place where you can boogie tonight... Michelle's Fabulous Friday party!
Your weekly 30 minutes of non-stop bops, and Michelle's Mood is... DRESS TO IMPRESS!
Sophie caps off a brilliant Piano Room month at Radio 2 with a set of piano flavoured dancefloor fillers in the Disco Wonderland from the likes of Dario G and Fatboy Slim.

programmes.show_name: The Rock Show with Shaun Keaveny
programmes.show_description: Shaun chats to Geddy Lee and Alex Lifeson from Rush following the announcement of a new tour, their first since the loss of drummer Neil Peart.

programmes.show_name: Romesh Ranganathan: For the Love of Hip Hop
programmes.show_description: Rom looks back at Eminem's album, The Marshall Mathers LP - released 25 years ago this year - exploring the making of the project and its cultural impact.
Tony serves up more tasty Soul vibes and RnB flavours! Including brilliant music from Sister Sledge, Mtume, Marvin Gaye, Michael Jackson, Patrice Isley and Stevie Wonder!
Mark Goodier counts down the chart from this day in 1990.
Mark Goodier counts down the chart from this day in 2003.
The Brothers Gibb - Barry, Robin and Maurice performing at the BBC Radio Theatre in 2001 with a set combining their classic hits along with tracks from This Is Where I Came In.

programmes.show_name: The Unwinds Mix with Angela Griffin
programmes.show_description: Take a woodland walk to calm your mind, soundtracked by Angela Griffin.

programmes.show_name: Sounds of the 60s with Tony Blackburn
programmes.show_description: Tony brings you two hours of music from the best decade ever, with hits from Reparata and the Delrons, Nancy Sinatra and Cilla Black. This week, the top three comes from 1966.
Comedian Tom Allen joins Dermot to chat about joining the cast of Titanique. And Alison Hammond talks Bridgerton. Plus some classic vinyl, a wedding call and The Mystery Voice.
Romesh brings the laughs, soundtracked by great music. As well as chatting to brilliant guests, he's sharing your hilarious stories, so you can start your Saturday with a smile!
Spend Saturday lunchtime with Emma and enjoy a menu full of your favourite music, great conversation and a delicious dive into the BBC archives for dessert.
Ruth Langsford pops in to talk about her book Feeling Fabulous and selects her all time favourite film and TV shows for her curated RY Player.
Shaun Keaveny sits in with fabulous teatime tunes and your tales of the extraordinary and the everyday.

programmes.show_name: Sounds of the 80s with Gary Davies
programmes.show_description: Lady A's Charles Kelley leans into the 80s on his latest album and chooses his favourite tracks from the decade on My 80s. Gary celebrates 80s Brit Award winners on the Mastermix.

programmes.show_name: Sounds of the 90s with Fearne Cotton
programmes.show_description: Join Fearne for a nostalgia drenched celebration of the best 90s music and pop culture.
